results.title: 52 Places to Go in 2016
results.abstract: It’s a big world out there, so we’ve narrowed it down for you. From the temples of Malta to the crystalline waters of the Yucatán, explore our top destinations to visit this year.

results.title: Dear Powerball Winner: Take Our Advice and Take the Annuity
results.abstract: Comparing payout options is fun to imagine, but also a useful way to think about taxes, investment opportunities and human nature.

media.caption: Actually, it’s either $1.5 billion (which the sign cannot accommodate) or $930 million, depending on how you choose to take your winnings.

results.title: For the Wealthiest, a Private Tax System That Saves Them Billions
results.abstract: The very richest are able to quietly shape tax policy that will allow them to shield billions in income.

media.caption: Daniel S. Loeb, shown with his wife, Margaret, runs the $17 billion Third Point hedge fund. Mr. Loeb, who has owned a home in East Hampton, has contributed to Jeb Bush’s super PAC and given $1 million to the American Unity Super PAC, which supports gay rights.

results.title: David Bowie Dies at 69; Star Transcended Music, Art and Fashion
results.abstract: Mr. Bowie taught generations of musicians about the power of drama, images and personas. He had been treated for cancer for the last 18 months.

media.caption: David Bowie at the Glastonbury Festival in 2000.

results.byline: By QUOCTRUNG BUI and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER
results.title: The Typical American Lives Only 18 Miles From Mom
results.abstract: The popular perception of Americans is that they are independent and rootless, but the reality is that people tend not to move very far from their parents.

results.adx_keywords: Trump, Donald J;Trump, Fred C Jr (1938-81);Presidential Election of 2016;Alcohol Abuse;Queens (NYC)
results.title: For Donald Trump, Lessons From a Brother’s Suffering
results.abstract: Mr. Trump, whose appeal is predicated on an aura of toughness and perpetual success, seldom speaks of his brother Freddy, who died as an alcoholic in 1981 at age 43.

media.caption: The Trump siblings — from left, Robert, Elizabeth, Freddy, Donald and Maryanne — in an undated photo. Freddy Trump, who died in 1981, was eight years older than Donald.

results.adx_keywords: Guzman Loera, Joaquin;Mexico;Penn, Sean;Drug Cartels;Drug Abuse and Traffic;Rolling Stone;Fugitives;Prison Escapes;Actors and Actresses;Sinaloa (Mexico)
results.title: Sean Penn Met With ‘El Chapo’ for Interview in His Hide-Out
results.abstract: Before he was captured, Joaquín Guzmán Loera met with the actor in his jungle hide-out for seven hours in October and spoke about his empire, Donald Trump and the movie business for Rolling Stone.

media.caption: The actor Sean Penn, left, and the drug lord Joaquín Guzmán Loera in a photo taken for interview authentication purposes.

results.title: The Lawyer Who Became DuPont’s Worst Nightmare
results.abstract: Rob Bilott was a corporate defense attorney for eight years. Then he took on an environmental suit that would upend his entire career — and expose a brazen, decades-long history of chemical pollution.
